marketNews.title: The Fed Lowers Expectations for Rate Cuts
marketNews.content:
The U.S. Bureau of Labor Statistics on Wednesday (12 June) reported that inflation eased in May 2024 and fell below expectations. Details: • Inflation month-over-month (MoM): 0.0% (consensus: 0.1%; April 2024: 0.3%). • Inflation year-over-year (YoY): 3.3% (consensus: 3.4%; April 2024: 3.4%). • Core inflation MoM: 0.2% (consensus: 0.3%; April 2024: 0.3%). • Core inflation YoY: 3.4% (consensus: 3.5%; April 2024: 3.6%).

A few hours after the inflation release, the Federal Reserve decided to keep the policy rate at 5.25-5.50% as market consensus expected. The Fed also released its latest dot-plot, showing that rate cuts in 2024 are projected to total only 25 basis points (one cut), down from the previous projection of 75 basis points (three cuts). The Fed said that to date only modest progress has been made toward achieving the 2% inflation target.

The above developments lifted market expectations for a rate cut in September 2024. According to the CME FedWatch Tool, the probability of the Fed starting to cut rates in September 2024 rose to 62.4% from 52.8% before the inflation release and the Fed meeting.

Following the inflation release and the Fed meeting, U.S. market data on Wednesday (12 June) showed: – U.S. Dollar Index (DXY) fell –0.59%. – U.S. equity indices rose: S&P +0.85%, Nasdaq +1.53%, DJIA –0.09%. – 10-year U.S. Treasury yield fell 10 basis points.

In Indonesia on Thursday (13 June): – The rupiah closed stronger by +0.06% at 16,286 per USD. – The Jakarta Composite Index (IHSG) fell –0.27% to 6,831. – The 10-year Indonesian government bond yield rose +6 basis points to 7.08%.

marketNews.title: Key Takeaway
marketNews.content:
The weak reaction in the rupiah, Indonesian government bond yields, and the Jakarta Composite Index on the day’s trading indicate that foreign investor interest has not yet returned to Indonesia. For Indonesia itself, we assess that Bank Indonesia can only start cutting rates if the rupiah strengthens convincingly. Consensus expects the central bank to begin easing in 4Q24.

To mitigate volatility risk from uncertain rate direction, investors can lock in high-yield government bonds – especially short-term series such as FR0081 and PBS032 – at attractive levels. Meanwhile, SBR013 can be used to hedge high-rate risk because it carries a floating-rate coupon with a floor. In the equity market, with valuations now cheap, the momentum can be used to accumulate quality stocks such as the Big 4 banks, $TLKM, and $ASII.

marketNews.title: BloombergNEF: Global Battery Surplus and Nickel Demand Outlook
marketNews.content: BloombergNEF estimates that global electric-vehicle battery supply will experience a surplus of up to five times by the end of 2025, driven by a wave of new plant construction worldwide. China is projected to face the sharpest oversupply, with a 400% battery surplus over the next decade. BloombergNEF also cut its 2025 forecast for nickel use in EV batteries by 25% as lithium-iron-phosphate (LFP) batteries gain popularity, especially among Chinese manufacturers.

marketNews.title: Investment Minister Bahlil Lahadalia on 2025 Investment Target
marketNews.content: Investment Minister Bahlil Lahadalia said the government targets 2025 investment realization of IDR 1,850-1,900 trillion, a rise of 12.1-15.2% from the 2024 target of IDR 1,650 trillion. Digital Economy Center Director Nailul Huda responded that the target is unfounded given uncertain global conditions.

marketNews.title: AISI Reports May 2024 Domestic Motorcycle Sales
marketNews.content: The Indonesian Motorcycle Industry Association (AISI) reported that domestic motorcycle sales in May 2024 reached 505,670 units (-4.5% YoY, +20.6% MoM). Cumulatively, 5-month sales reached 2.66 million units (-1.8% YoY), representing 40.9-42.9% of the 2024 target of 6.2-6.5 million units. AISI Commercial Division Chairman Sigit Kumala said the motor-sales trend remains fairly positive despite declining consumer purchasing power.

marketNews.title: Gaikindo Expects GIIAS 2024 to Boost Car Sales
marketNews.content: Gaikindo Chairman III Rizwan Alamsjah said the organization hopes the 2024 Gaikindo Indonesia International Auto Show (GIIAS) in July will support car sales. The show will feature 55 brands and 40 new vehicle models. In the first five months of 2024, wholesale car sales in Indonesia reached only 334,897 units (-21% YoY), covering 30.4% of the 1.1 million-unit 2024 target set by Gaikindo.

marketNews.title: CNI Plans 2025 IPO and New Smelter Projects
marketNews.content: PT Ceria Nugraha Indotama (CNI) plans an initial public offering on the Indonesia Stock Exchange in the first half of 2025. CEO Derian Sakmiwata said the company will start operating the RKEF smelter, valued at IDR 5 trillion, in 2024 with a production capacity of 13,000 tonnes of ferronickel per year. CNI also plans to build an HPAL smelter with 146.6 kMHP per year at a cost of IDR 30 trillion, and Glencore Plc. will purchase all output from the HPAL plant.

tickerNews.title: BRPT to Distribute 150 Million Bonus Shares
tickerNews.content: Barito Pacific (BRPT) plans to distribute 185.4 million treasury shares, of which 150 million will be issued as a bonus issue and 35.4 million through the MESOP program. The bonus issue will be at a 625-to-1 ratio. The cum-date is the regular market and negotiation on 26 June 2024, with the bonus distribution on 19 July 2024. After this transaction, BRPT’s treasury-share count will be reduced to zero.

tickerNews.title: HRUM Targets 2024 Nickel Production and New HPAL Smelter
tickerNews.content: Harum Energy (HRUM) President Director Ray A. Gunara said the company targets limestone nickel ore production of 500,000-1 million tonnes in 2024. NPI production is targeted to grow +204-257% to 23.8-28 thousand tonnes following the September 2023 consolidation of PT Infei Metal Industry. HRUM also targets nickel-matte output of 38-42 thousand tonnes as PT Westrong Metal Industry begins operations in March 2024. Ray added that the HPAL smelter with 67 kMHP per year owned by subsidiary PT Blue Sparking Energy will start operating in 1Q 2026.

tickerNews.title: INTP Reports 21% YoY Cement Sales Growth in May 2024
tickerNews.content: Indocement Tunggal Prakarsa (INTP) recorded a 21% year-over-year increase in cement sales volume in May 2024, raising its market-share to 29.3% (May 2023: 27%). The growth was driven by Java, where sales rose 25% YoY and market-share climbed to 37% (May 2023: 33.4%). Outside Java, sales volume grew 14.4% YoY and market-share rose to 20.5% (May 2023: 19.7%). National cement sales volume grew 11.5% YoY in May 2024.

tickerNews.title: UNVR Sells Ice-Cream Production Equipment to Unilever Thailand
tickerNews.content: Unilever Indonesia (UNVR) sold production equipment for a specific ice-cream line and its accessories to its affiliate Unilever Thailand. The transaction value was €3.3 million. The sale is expected to have a positive effect on the company as it can refocus on core ice-cream products.

tickerNews.title: MYOR Sets 2024 Net-Profit and Sales Targets
tickerNews.content: Mayora Indah (MYOR) President Director Wardhana Atmadja said the company targets a 7.2% YoY increase in net profit for 2024 to IDR 3.47 trillion, and a sales target of IDR 34.28 trillion (up 8.9% YoY). To achieve this, MYOR will allocate IDR 1.5 trillion in capex for a new plant in Pasuruan and for maintenance. In the first four months of 2024, net profit rose 49.4% YoY to IDR 1.2 trillion and sales grew 5.8% YoY to IDR 10.83 trillion.

tickerNews.title: TPMA Adds New Tug Boat and Sets 2024 Capex Plan
tickerNews.content: Trans Power Marine (TPMA) President Director Rudy Sutiono said the company has added one new tug boat to its target of adding nine tug boats in 2024. With the addition, TPMA now operates 40 tug boats, 35 barges and three floating cranes to serve bulk-commodity transport, including coal. For 2024 the company allocated USD 20 million for the purchase of two tug boats, six barges and one floating crane, and targets a 10-20% YoY increase in revenue and net profit.

tickerNews.title: Paraga Artamida Purchases 18.6 Million BSDE Shares
tickerNews.content: Paraga Artamida, the controlling shareholder of Bumi Serpong Damai (BSDE), bought approximately 18.6 million BSDE shares at an average price of IDR 942.43 per share between 5-11 June 2024, for a total transaction value of about IDR 17.5 billion. After the transaction, Paraga Artamida’s ownership in BSDE rose from 40.0% to 40.1%.

tickerNews.title: CUAN Chairman Erwin Ciputra Buys 150 Thousand Shares
tickerNews.content: Petrindo Jaya Kreasi (CUAN) Chairman Erwin Ciputra bought 150 thousand CUAN shares at an average price of IDR 8,121 per share on 10 June 2024. The transaction value was about IDR 1.22 billion. After the purchase, Ciputra’s ownership in CUAN increased from 0.012% to 0.013%.
